wiki.text:
In linear algebra, the 'Cholesky decomposition' or 'Cholesky triangle' is a
decomposition of a Hermitian, positive-definite matrix into the product of a
lower triangular matrix and its conjugate transpose. It was discovered by André-
Louis Cholesky for real matrices. When it is applicable, the Cholesky
decomposition is roughly twice as efficient as the LU decomposition for solving
systems of linear equations.<ref></ref>
